meanings.definition: Causing or relating to sexual arousal.
meanings.sent1: The romantic movie had an erotogenic scene that made the audience blush.
meanings.sent2: The soft music created an erotogenic atmosphere for the couple.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy's antics had an erotogenic effect on the family.
meanings.sent4: The vibrant colors of the painting were erotogenic, evoking passion in the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The warm summer breeze carried an erotogenic scent of blooming flowers.

meanings.sent1: The luxurious silk sheets felt erotogenic against her skin.
meanings.sent2: The decadent chocolate cake was an erotogenic treat for the taste buds.
meanings.sent3: The cozy cabin by the lake was an erotogenic retreat for the couple.
meanings.sent4: The soothing massage oil had an erotogenic effect, relaxing the tense muscles.
meanings.sent5: The velvety texture of the rose petals was erotogenic to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The flirtatious glances were erotogenic, igniting a spark between them.
meanings.sent2: The alluring perfume had an erotogenic effect on those nearby.
meanings.sent3: The tantalizing aroma of freshly baked bread was strangely erotogenic.
meanings.sent4: The captivating novel had an erotogenic plot that kept readers engaged.
meanings.sent5: The seductive dance moves were erotogenic, drawing in the mesmerized audience.
